api_contracts.description: Returns a simple Hello World greeting message

component_logic.responsibility: Handles GET /hello requests and returns Hello World response with timestamp

interfaces.description: Returns Hello World message with current timestamp and success status
Formats response with message, timestamp, and status fields

component_logic.implementation_notes: Use datetime.utcnow().isoformat() + 'Z' for timestamp in UTC. Return exactly 'Hello World' as message text. Include status field set to 'success'. Handle any exceptions and return 500 error. Use FastAPI route decorator @app.get('/hello').

design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: API contract must use GET method for /hello endpoint. Response must be JSON format with consistent structure.
Component must handle exceptions and return 500 status code with proper error message format. No unhandled exceptions should crash the application.
Response must always include message, timestamp, and status fields. Message must be exactly 'Hello World'. Timestamp must be valid ISO 8601 format.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify endpoint has minimal processing overhead
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: Handler should execute in under 10ms. No database calls or external API calls. Simple string formatting and timestamp generation only.
Response must not include server details, internal paths, or system information. Only return specified message, timestamp, and status fields.

design_review_checklist.description: Verify component follows single responsibility principle
design_review_checklist.validation_criteria: HelloWorldHandler must only handle /hello endpoint logic. No additional business logic or unrelated functionality.

architecture_overview: Simple single-endpoint REST API with minimal architecture. HelloWorldHandler component processes GET requests to /hello endpoint and returns JSON response with Hello World message, UTC timestamp, and success status. No database or external dependencies required. FastAPI framework handles HTTP routing and JSON serialization.
assumptions: No authentication or authorization required for /hello endpoint
Response format includes timestamp for request tracking purposes
UTC timezone used for all timestamps
No rate limiting required for simple hello endpoint
JSON response format preferred over plain text
FastAPI framework handles HTTP request/response lifecycle automatically
